content.introduction:
memfd_create()
 should include 
MFD_CLOEXEC
 in its type argument to avoid
the file descriptor leakage. Without this flag, an opened sensitive file would
remain open across a fork+exec to a lower-privileged SELinux domain.

Examples:

memfd_create
(
name
,
 
MFD_ALLOW_SEALING
);



// becomes



memfd_create
(
name
,
 
MFD_ALLOW_SEALING
 
|
 
MFD_CLOEXEC
);
